name: Senecio aureus
Relationship: Compare: SENECIO JACOBAEA (cerebrospinal irritation, rigid muscles, chiefly of neck and shoulders; also, in cancer); ALETRIS; CAULOP.; SEP.

Head: Dull, stupefying headache
Fullness of nasal passages; burning; sneezing; profuse flow
Wavelike dizziness from occiput to sinciput
Sharp pains over left eye, and through left temple
Respiratory: Acute inflammatory conditions of upper respiratory tract
Dry teasing cough, stitching chest pains
Urine: Irritable bladder of children, with headache
Scanty, high-colored, bloody, with much mucus and tenesmus
Mind: Inability to fix mind upon any one subject
Abdomen: Pain around umbilicus; spreads all over abdomen; better, stool
Straining at stool; thin, dark, bloody, with tenesmus
Thin, watery stool, intermingled with hard lumps of feces
Face: Dryness of fauces, throat and mouth
Female: Functional amenorrhoea of young girls with backache
Before menses, inflammatory conditions of throat, chest, and bladder
Throat: Burning in pharynx, raw feeling in nasopharynx, must swallow, though painful
Male: Dull, heavy pain in spermatic cord, extending to testicles

details: Its action on the female organism has been clinically verified. Urinary organs also affected in a marked degree. Backaches of congested kidneys. Early cirrhosis of liver.
dosage: Tincture, to third potency. SENECIN., first trituration.
